result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant was charged with both Operating While under Influence (6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony] and Operating with PAC of .02 or More (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating While under Influence (6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony] and the other charge, Operating with PAC of .02 or More (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony] was dismissed by the court.

  • Donald W. LaCroix was found guilty of Operating While under Influence (6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**AMENDED** Per Judge Needham on 6/7/10.  The Court orders a Risk Reduction Sentence and the defendant agrees to participate in assessment and programming.

Count 2, felony, in deferred status.
Count 3 dismissed.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine paid in full from bond on file.

1.  MAINTAIN  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
2.  Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
3.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
4.  Undergo any ordered DOC programming.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
**AMENDED** Per Judge Needham on 06/15/10 balance of attorney fees payable through Extended Supervision or taken from prison wages.

CO: SRN, Rpr: Byrns, Clerk: Carey, ADA: F Collins, Def Atty: Andrew Nelson with Donald LaCroix.  DOC Agent Sonnenberg present.  Court has reviewed PSI, no corrections by parties.  Recommendations and statements made to the Court by attorney's.  Def's wife addresses the Court, def makes statement.  
Sentence:  Def agrees to participate in Risk Reduction sentence, Court orders same.  Ct 1 - 6 yrs 0 mos total sentence; IC - 3 yrs 0 mos, ES - 3 yrs 0 mos.  Def is eligible for earned release.  Conditions of ES: MAINTAIN  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY;  Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol; AODA; any ordered DOC programming; Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license; 24 mos DL revocation; ignition interlock device; FF $2,000 (inclusive of costs, payable thru probation); Credit for 3 days time served.  Def remanded to the Sheriff's Dept.  Bond revoked, cash on file to be retained for fines and atty fees.  Def to be transferred to Dodge for risk assessment and directive programming.  Ct 2 remains in deferred status.  kc

ADA Collins informs Crt of agreement. DE pleads guilty to Ct 1 and Ct 2 in 10CF1. DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and Ct 2 in 10CF1. Crt enters JOC on Ct 1 but deferrs JOC on Ct 2. Crt signs and approves Deferred on Ct 2. Ct 3 is merged and dismissed. Crt orders PSI. Crt has no objection to short form if prior PSI was completed. 10TR67 and 10TR132 are dismissed. Bond continued. -bj
